                filter             field ## 1     CompoundIdFilter       compound_id ## 2      ExactmassFilter         exactmass ## 3        FormulaFilter           formula ## 4          InchiFilter             inchi ## 5       InchikeyFilter          inchikey ## 8 MsmsMzRangeMaxFilter msms_mz_range_max ## 7 MsmsMzRangeMinFilter msms_mz_range_min ## 6           NameFilter              name ## 9     SpectrumIdFilter       spectrum_id compounds(cdb, columns = c("compound_id", "name", "formula"),           filter = ~ name == "Mellein" & compound_id %in% c(1, 5)) ##   compound_id  formula    name ## 1           1 C10H10O3 Mellein ## 2           5 C10H10O3 Mellein compounds(cdb, columns = c("name", "exactmass"),           filter = ~ exactmass > 310 & exactmass < 320) ## 1 C17H14O6  314.0790 Aflatoxin B2 ## 2 C17H14O7  330.0739 Aflatoxin G2 filters <- AnnotationFilterList(     FormulaFilter("H14", "contains"),     ExactmassFilter(310, ">"),     ExactmassFilter(320, "<"),     logicOp = c("&", "&")) compounds(cdb, columns = c("name", "formula", "exactmass"),           filter = filters) ##    formula exactmass         name ## 1 C17H14O6   314.079 Aflatoxin B2

title: Usage of Annotation Resources with the CompoundDb Package
text: CompDb database layout designed provide compound annotations, mass spectrometry (MS) ions measured. ions generated e.g. electro spray ionization (ESI) original compounds sample. characterized specific mass--charge ratio (m/z) measured MS instrument. Eventually, also retention time available. Also, compound several different ions (adducts) can formed measured, different m/z. type data can represented IonDb database, extends CompDb hence inherits properties adds additional database tables support also ion annotations. Also, IonDb objects provide functionality add new ion annotations existing database. Thus, type database can used build lab-internal annotation resources containing ions, m/z retention times pure standards measured specific e.g. LC-MS setup. CompDb databases, cdb example, however default read-, thus, create new database connection, copy content cdb database convert CompDb IonDb. IonDb defines additional function ions allows retrieve ion information database. present database yet contain ion information. define data frame ion annotations add database insertIon function. column "compound_id" needs contain identifiers compounds ion related . present example add 2 different ions compound ID 1 (Mellein). Note specified m/z values well retention times completely arbitrary. ions now added database. Ions can also deleted database deleteIon function (see respective help page information). Note can also retrieve compound annotation information ions. extract associated compound name exact mass.
code: library(RSQLite) ## Create a temporary database con <- dbConnect(SQLite(), tempfile()) ## Create an IonDb copying the content of cdb to the new database idb <- IonDb(con, cdb) idb ## class: IonDb  ##  data source: MassBank  ##  version: 2020.09  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 70  ##  MS/MS spectra count: 70  ##  ion count: 0 ions(idb) ## [1] compound_id ion_adduct  ion_mz      ion_rt      ## <0 rows> (or 0-length row.names) ion <- data.frame(compound_id = c(1, 1),                   ion_adduct = c("[M+H]+", "[M+Na]+"),                   ion_mz = c(123.34, 125.34),                   ion_rt = c(196, 196)) idb <- insertIon(idb, ion) ions(idb) ##   compound_id ion_adduct ion_mz ion_rt ## 1           1     [M+H]+ 123.34    196 ## 2           1    [M+Na]+ 125.34    196 ions(idb, columns = c("ion_adduct", "name", "exactmass")) ##   ion_adduct    name exactmass ## 1     [M+H]+ Mellein   178.063 ## 2    [M+Na]+ Mellein   178.063

title: Creating CompoundDb annotation resources
text: Chemical compound annotation information can retrieved variety sources including HMDB, LipidMaps ChEBI. CompoundDb package provides functionality extract data relevant (chromatographic) peak annotations metabolomics/lipidomics experiments sources store common format (.e. CompDb object/database). vignette describes CompDb objects can created exemplified package-internal test files represent data subsets annotation resources. R object represent compound annotation CompDb object. object (respectively database) supposed contain provide annotations single source (e.g. HMDB LipidMaps) also possible create cross-source databases .

title: Creating CompoundDb annotation resources
text: CompDb database can also created custom, manually defined annotations. illustrate create first data.frame arbitrary compound annotations. According ?createCompDb help page, data frame needs columns "compound_id", "name", "inchi", "inchikey", "formula", "exactmass", "synonyms". columns except "compound_id" can also contain missing values. also possible define additional columns. thus create data.frame compound annotations well additional columns. Note annotations example illustration purposes means real. Also, don’t provide information columns "inchi", "inchikey" "formula" setting values NA. Next add also synonyms compound. columns supports multiple values row. also need define metadata database, make_metadata function. information can already create first rudimentary CompDb database contains compound annotations. thus create custom CompDb database temporary directory. also manually specify name database dbFile parameter - provided, name database constructed based information metadata parameter. real-case scenario, path dbFile changed something meaningful. can now load toy database using CompDb function providing full path database file. Note load database read-write mode specifying flags = RSQLite::SQLITE_RW - default CompDb load databases read-mode hence ensuring data within database can compromised. case however like add information database later hence load read-write mode. can now retrieve annotations database compound function. also search filter annotations. Next like add also MS2 spectra data database. either done directly createCompDb call parameter msms_spectra, insertSpectra function allows add MS2 spectra data existing CompDb can provided Spectra object. thus manually create Spectra object arbitrary MS2 spectra - alternatively, Spectra can imported variety input sources, including MGF MSP files using e.g. MsBackendMgf MsBackendMsp packages. Spectra object needs also variable (column) called "compound_id" provides information existing compound database spectrum associated. can also add additional information spectra, instrument. can now add spectra existing toy CompDb. Parameter columns allows specify spectra variables stored database. thus now CompDb database compound annotations 3 MS2 spectra. example also retrieve MS2 spectra compound name database :
code: cmps <- data.frame(     compound_id = c("CP_0001", "CP_0002", "CP_0003", "CP_0004"),     name = c("A", "B", "C", "D"),     inchi = NA_character_,     inchikey = NA_character_,     formula = NA_character_,     exactmass = c(123.4, 234.5, 345.6, 456.7),     compound_group = c("G01", "G02", "G01", "G03") ) cmps$synonyms <- list(     c("a", "AA", "aaa"),     c(),     c("C", "c"),     ("d") ) metad <- make_metadata(source = "manually defined", url = "",                        source_version = "1.0.0", source_date = "2022-03-01",                        organism = NA_character_)  db_file <- createCompDb(cmps, metadata = metad, path = tempdir(),                         dbFile = "CompDb.test.sqlite") cdb <- CompDb(db_file, flags = RSQLite::SQLITE_RW) cdb ## class: CompDb  ##  data source: manually defined  ##  version: 1.0.0  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 4 compounds(cdb) ##   name inchi inchikey formula exactmass compound_group ## 1    A  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     123.4            G01 ## 2    B  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     234.5            G02 ## 3    C  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     345.6            G01 ## 4    D  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     456.7            G03 compounds(cdb, filter = ~ name %in% c("B", "A")) ##   name inchi inchikey formula exactmass compound_group ## 1    A  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     123.4            G01 ## 2    B  <NA>     <NA>    <NA>     234.5            G02 #' Define basic spectra variables df <- DataFrame(msLevel = 2L, precursorMz = c(124.4, 124.4, 235.5)) #' Add m/z and intensity information for each spectrum df$mz <- list(     c(3, 20, 59.1),     c(2, 10, 30, 59.1),     c(100, 206, 321.1)) df$intensity <- list(     c(10, 13, 45),     c(5, 8, 9, 43),     c(10, 20, 400)) #' Create the Spectra object sps <- Spectra(df) compounds(cdb, "compound_id") ##   compound_id ## 1     CP_0001 ## 2     CP_0002 ## 3     CP_0003 ## 4     CP_0004 sps$compound_id <- c("CP_0001", "CP_0001", "CP_0002") sps$instrument <- "AB Sciex TripleTOF 5600+" cdb <- insertSpectra(cdb, spectra = sps,                      columns = c("compound_id", "msLevel",                                  "precursorMz", "instrument")) cdb ## class: CompDb  ##  data source: manually defined  ##  version: 1.0.0  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 4  ##  MS/MS spectra count: 3 Spectra(cdb, filter = ~ name == "A") ## MSn data (Spectra) with 2 spectra in a MsBackendCompDb backend: ##     msLevel precursorMz  polarity ##   <integer>   <numeric> <integer> ## 1         2       124.4        NA ## 2         2       124.4        NA ##  ... 31 more variables/columns. ##  Use  'spectraVariables' to list all of them. ##  data source: manually defined  ##  version: 1.0.0  ##  organism: NA

title: Creating CompoundDb annotation resources
text: MoNa (Massbank North America) provides large SDF file spectra can used create CompDb object compound information MS/MS spectra. Note however MoNa organized spectra annotation compounds consistent normalized. Spectra compound can compound identified data e.g. can differ chemical formula, precision exact mass fields. Similar example , compound annotations can imported compound_tbl_sdf function spectrum data can imported msms_spectra_mona. example use however import_mona_sdf wraps functions reads compound spectrum data SDF file without import file twice. example use small subset MoNa SDF file contains 7 spectra. result get list data.frame compound spectrum information. can passed along createCompDb function create database (see ). can now load use database, e.g. extracting compounds shown . stated introduction section compound information contains redundant information table essentially one row per spectrum. Feedback reduce redundancy ms_compound table highly appreciated.
code: mona_sub <- system.file("sdf/MoNa_export-All_Spectra_sub.sdf.gz",                         package = "CompoundDb") mona_data <- import_mona_sdf(mona_sub) ## Warning: MoNa data can currently not be normalized and the compound table ## contains thus highly redundant data. metad <- make_metadata(source = "MoNa",                        url = "http://mona.fiehnlab.ucdavis.edu/",                        source_version = "2018.11", source_date = "2018-11",                        organism = "Unspecified") mona_db_file <- createCompDb(mona_data$compound, metadata = metad,                              msms_spectra = mona_data$msms_spectrum,                              path = tempdir()) mona <- CompDb(mona_db_file) compounds(mona) ##                   name ## 1 Sulfachlorpyridazine ## 2         Sulfaclozine ## 3        Sulfadimidine ## 4       Sulfamethazine ## 5       Sulfamethazine ##                                                                                                      inchi ## 1             InChI=1S/C10H9ClN4O2S/c11-9-5-6-10(14-13-9)15-18(16,17)8-3-1-7(12)2-4-8/h1-6H,12H2,(H,14,15) ## 2             InChI=1S/C10H9ClN4O2S/c11-9-5-13-6-10(14-9)15-18(16,17)8-3-1-7(12)2-4-8/h1-6H,12H2,(H,14,15) ## 3 InChI=1S/C12H14N4O2S/c1-8-7-9(2)15-12(14-8)16-19(17,18)11-5-3-10(13)4-6-11/h3-7H,13H2,1-2H3,(H,14,15,16) ## 4 InChI=1S/C12H14N4O2S/c1-8-7-9(2)15-12(14-8)16-19(17,18)11-5-3-10(13)4-6-11/h3-7H,13H2,1-2H3,(H,14,15,16) ## 5 InChI=1S/C12H14N4O2S/c1-8-7-9(2)15-12(14-8)16-19(17,18)11-5-3-10(13)4-6-11/h3-7H,13H2,1-2H3,(H,14,15,16) ##                      inchikey      formula exactmass smiles ## 1 XOXHILFPRYWFOD-UHFFFAOYSA-N C10H9ClN4O2S  284.0135   <NA> ## 2 QKLPUVXBJHRFQZ-UHFFFAOYSA-N C10H9ClN4O2S  284.0135   <NA> ## 3 ASWVTGNCAZCNNR-UHFFFAOYSA-N  C12H14N4O2S  278.0837   <NA> ## 4 ASWVTGNCAZCNNR-UHFFFAOYSA-N  C12H14N4O2S  278.0837   <NA> ## 5 ASWVTGNCAZCNNR-UHFFFAOYSA-N  C12H14N4O2S  278.0837   <NA>

title: Creating CompoundDb annotation resources
text: alternative creating full database existing resource also possible create empty CompDb database sequentially filling data. example used create laboratory specific annotation library compound, ion fragment spectra pure standards measured certain LC-MS setup. create empty CompDb database providing file name database. example store database temporary file real use case meaningful file name file path used instead. next define first compound annotation want add database. compound annotations, fields "compound_id" (arbitrary ID compound), "name" (compound name), "inchi", "inchikey", "formula" (chemical formula) "exactmass" (monoisotopic mass) expected, , except "compound_id", can also contain missing values completely omitted. define data.frame annotations compounds add annotation database using insertCompound function. next add fragment spectra compounds. example represent MS2 spectra measured pure standard compound extracted example xcms result objects sources. load fragment spectra caffeine MGF file distributed package. use MsBackendMgf package import data Spectra object. can evaluate spectra variables available imported data. many variables available, , like example retention time, defined information provided MGF file. order associate fragment spectra caffeine compound just added database, need assign ID compound (case "1"). can add spectra database using insertSpectra function. parameter columns specify spectra variables actually want store database. thus now 2 compounds database 2 fragment spectra: insertCommpound insertSpectra compounds fragment spectra added database. Note functions support also add additional columns (fields variables) database. example define compound arbitrary additional column add database using parameter addColumns = TRUE. additional column now available database. Existing entries CompDb can also deleted using deleteCompound deleteSpectra functions. require additional input IDs compound(s) (spectra) delete. extract IDs names compounds database. can now delete compound "X003" deleteCompound ID compound. Note deleting compound associated spectra (ions) result error, thus possible delete caffeine database, contains also MS2 spectra compound. Using parameter recursive = TRUE deleteCompound call however allow delete compound associated spectra (/ions) along . delete thus caffeine associated MS2 spectra leaves us CompDb single compound MS2 spectra. Note functions can also used add remove annotations /CompDb database, long database writeable (.e. database loaded specifying flags = RSQLite::SQLITE_RW additional parameter CompDb call load database).
code: dbfile <- tempfile() mydb <- emptyCompDb(dbfile) mydb ## class: CompDb  ##  data source: NA  ##  version: NA  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 0 cmp <- data.frame(compound_id = c("1", "2"),                   name = c("Caffeine", "Glucose"),                   formula = c("C8H10N4O2", "C6H12O6"),                   exactmass = c(194.080375584, 180.063388116)) mydb <- insertCompound(mydb, cmp) mydb ## class: CompDb  ##  data source: NA  ##  version: NA  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 2 library(MsBackendMgf) caf_ms2 <- Spectra(system.file("mgf", "caffeine.mgf", package = "CompoundDb"),                    source = MsBackendMgf()) caf_ms2 ## MSn data (Spectra) with 2 spectra in a MsBackendMgf backend: ##     msLevel     rtime scanIndex ##   <integer> <numeric> <integer> ## 1         2        NA        NA ## 2         2        NA        NA ##  ... 25 more variables/columns. spectraVariables(caf_ms2) ##  [1] "msLevel"                 "rtime"                   ##  [3] "acquisitionNum"          "scanIndex"               ##  [5] "dataStorage"             "dataOrigin"              ##  [7] "centroided"              "smoothed"                ##  [9] "polarity"                "precScanNum"             ## [11] "precursorMz"             "precursorIntensity"      ## [13] "precursorCharge"         "collisionEnergy"         ## [15] "isolationWindowLowerMz"  "isolationWindowTargetMz" ## [17] "isolationWindowUpperMz"  "TITLE"                   ## [19] "original_spectrum_id"    "compound_id"             ## [21] "collision_energy"        "predicted"               ## [23] "splash"                  "spectrum_id"             ## [25] "msms_mz_range_min"       "msms_mz_range_max" caf_ms2$rtime ## [1] NA NA caf_ms2$compound_id <- "1" mydb <- insertSpectra(mydb, caf_ms2,                       columns = c("compound_id", "msLevel", "splash",                                   "precursorMz", "collisionEnergy")) mydb ## class: CompDb  ##  data source: NA  ##  version: NA  ##  organism: NA  ##  compound count: 2  ##  MS/MS spectra count: 2 compounds(mydb) ##       name inchi inchikey   formula exactmass ## 1 Caffeine  <NA>     <NA> C8H10N4O2  194.0804 ## 2  Glucose  <NA>     <NA>   C6H12O6  180.0634 sps <- Spectra(mydb) sps$name ## [1] "Caffeine" "Caffeine" cmps <- data.frame(compound_id = "3", name = "X003",                    formula = "C5H2P3O", extra_field = "artificial compound") mydb <- insertCompound(mydb, cmps, addColumns = TRUE) compounds(mydb) ##       name inchi inchikey   formula exactmass         extra_field ## 1 Caffeine  <NA>     <NA> C8H10N4O2  194.0804                <NA> ## 2  Glucose  <NA>     <NA>   C6H12O6  180.0634                <NA> ## 3     X003  <NA>     <NA>   C5H2P3O        NA artificial compound compounds(mydb, columns = c("compound_id", "name")) ##   compound_id     name ## 1           1 Caffeine ## 2           2  Glucose ## 3           3     X003 mydb <- deleteCompound(mydb, ids = "3") compounds(mydb) ##       name inchi inchikey   formula exactmass extra_field ## 1 Caffeine  <NA>     <NA> C8H10N4O2  194.0804        <NA> ## 2  Glucose  <NA>     <NA>   C6H12O6  180.0634        <NA> mydb <- deleteCompound(mydb, ids = "1", recursive = TRUE) compounds(mydb) ## title: Simple compound (metabolite) databases — CompDb
text: x CompDb: character(1) file name SQLite compound database. Alternatively possible provide connection database parameter x. copyCompDb: either CompDb database connection.   flags flags passed SQLite database connection. See SQLite(). Defaults read-, .e. RSQLite::SQLITE_RO. y copyCompDb: connection database content copied. object methods: CompDb object. filter compounds Spectra: filter expression AnnotationFilter() defining filter used retrieve specific elements database. ... additional arguments. Currently used. includeId compoundVariables: logical(1) whether comound ID (column "compound_id") included result. default includeIds = FALSE. columns compounds, Spectra: character names database columns retrieved. Use compoundVariables /spectraVariables list available column names. insertSpectra: columns (spectra variables) inserted database (avoid inserting variables). return.type compounds: either "data.frame" "tibble" return result data.frame() tibble(), respectively. spectra insertSpectra: Spectra object containing spectra added IonDb database. ids deleteSpectra: integer() specifying IDs spectra delete. IDs ids associated spectra CompDb object ignored. deleteCompound: character() compound IDs deleted. adduct either character specifying name(s) adduct(s) m/z calculated data.frame adduct definition. See adductNames() supported adduct names description information expected format data.frame provided. name mass2mz: character(1). Defines CompDb column used name/identify returned m/z values. default (name = "formula") m/z values unique molecular formulas calculated used rownames returned matrix. name = "compound_id" adduct m/z compounds (even equal formulas) calculated returned. compounds insertCompound: data.frame compound data inserted CompDb database. See function description details. addColumns insertCompound: logical(1) whether (extra) columns parameter compounds stored also database table. default addColumns = FALSE. recursive deleteCompound: logical(1) whether also MS2 spectra associated compounds deleted.

text: Annotations/compound informations can retrieved CompDb database compounds Spectra functions: compounds extracts compound data CompDb object. contrast src_compdb returns actual data data.frame (return.type = "data.frame") tibble::tibble() (return.type = "tibble"). compounds call always return elements ms_compound table (unless filter used). Spectra extract spectra database returns Spectra() object Spectra package. Additional annotations requested columns parameter added additional spectra variables.

title: Simple compound (metabolite) databases — CompDb
text: CompDb: connect compound database. compoundVariables: returns available columns/database fields compounds. copyCompDb: allows copy content CompDb another database. Parameter x supposed either CompDb database connection data copied y connection database copied. dbconn: returns connection (type DBIConnection) database. metadata: returns general meta data compound database. spectraVariables: returns spectra variables (.e. columns) available CompDb. src_compdb provides access CompDb's database via functionality dplyr/dbplyr package. supportedFilters: provides overview filters can applied CompDb object extract specific data database. tables: returns named list (names table names) fields/columns table database. mass2mz: calculates table m/z values compound based provided set adduct(s). Adduct definitions can provided parameter adduct. See MetaboCoreUtils::mass2mz() details. Parameter name defines database table column used rownames returned matrix. default name = "formula", m/z values calculated unique formula CompDb x.

what: Adding and removing data from a database
title: Simple compound (metabolite) databases — CompDb
text: Note inserting deleting data requires read-write access database. Databases returned CompDb default read-. get write access CompDb called parameter flags = RSQLite::SQLITE_RW. insertCompound: adds additional compound(s) CompDb. compound(s) added can specified parameter compounds expected data.frame columns "compound_id", "name", "inchi", "inchikey", "formula", "exactmass". Column "exactmass" expected contain numeric values, columns character. Missing values allowed columns except "compound_id". optional column "synonyms" can used provide alternative names compound. column can contain single character row, list multiple character (names) per row/compound (see examples details). setting parameter addColumns = TRUE additional columns compound added database table. default addColumns = FALSE. function returns CompDb compounds added. See also createCompDb() information details expected compound data examples general usage. deleteCompound: removes specified compounds CompDb database. IDs compounds deleted need provided parameter ids. include compound IDs output compounds call "compound_id" added columns parameter. default error thrown specified compounds also MS2 spectra present database. force deletion compounds along associated MS2 spectra use recursive = TRUE. See examples details. function returns updated CompDb database. insertSpectra: adds spectra database. method always adds spectra specified spectra parameter check already database. Note input spectra must variable compound_id Spectra whose compound_id values also compounds(object, "compound_id") can added. what: Filters supported by CompDb and IonDb — Filter-classes
title: Filters supported by CompDb and IonDb — Filter-classes
text: variety different filters can applied CompDb object retrieve subsets data. filters extend AnnotationFilter::AnnotationFilter class support filtering concepts introduced Bioconductor's AnnotationFilter package. supported filters : CompoundIdFilter: filter based compound ID. FormulaFilter: filter based compound's formula. InchiFilter: filter based compound's InChI. InchikeyFilter: filter based compound's InChI key. ExactmassFilter: filter based compound's (exact) mass. NameFilter: filter based compound name. MsmsMzRangeMinFilter: retrieve entries based smallest m/z peaks MS/MS spectra. Requires MS/MS spectra data present (.e. hasMsMsSpectra(cmp_db) returns TRUE). MsmsMzRangeMaxFilter: retrieve entries based largest m/z peaks MS/MS spectra. Requires MS/MS spectra data present (.e. hasMsMsSpectra(cmp_db) returns TRUE). SpectrumIdFilter: retrieve entries associated provided IDs MS/MS spectra. addition filters listed , following ones supported IonDb (CompDb): IonIdFilter: filter based ion ID. IonAdductFilter: filter based adduct. IonMzFilter: filter based mz ion. IonRtFilter: filter based rt ion.

title: IonDb: compound database with additional ion information — IonDb
text: IonDb objects extends CompDb allowing store also information measured ions CompDb() database. information includes type (adduct) ion, measured (expected) retention time certain LC-MS setup mass--charge ratio. suggested use case, users might create (download) CompDb (SQLite) database e.g. containing compound (eventually MS/MS spectra) annotations public databases Human Metabolome Database (HMDB) MassBank. store now measured ions (e.g. lab-internal standards) certain LC-MS setup, CompDb can converted IonDb using IonDb constructor function. Ions can subsequently added using insertIon function. general, suggested create one IonDb database one specific LC-MS setup. IonDb database can used match experimental m/z retention times ions defined database (using functionality MetaboAnnotation package).

title: IonDb: compound database with additional ion information — IonDb
text: Andrea Vicini, Johannes Rainer

title: IonDb: compound database with additional ion information — IonDb
code: # We load a small compound test database based on MassBank which is # distributed with this package. cdb <- CompDb(system.file("sql/CompDb.MassBank.sql", package = "CompoundDb")) cdb #> class: CompDb  #>  data source: MassBank  #>  version: 2020.09  #>  organism: NA  #>  compound count: 70  #>  MS/MS spectra count: 70   # We next want to convert this CompDb into an IonDb, but the original CompDb # database is read only, thus we have to provide the name (or connection) of # an other database to transfer all the data from the CompDb to that. idb <- IonDb(paste0(tempdir(), "/idb_ex.db"), cdb) idb #> class: IonDb  #>  data source: MassBank  #>  version: 2020.09  #>  organism: NA  #>  compound count: 70  #>  MS/MS spectra count: 70  #>  ion count: 0   # It is also possible to load a previously created IonDb passing only the # connection to the database. idb2 <- IonDb(paste0(tempdir(), "/idb_ex.db"))  # Ion definitions can be added to the database with the `insertIon` function # providing a `data.frame` with ion definition. This `data.frame` is expected # to provide the IDs of the compounds, an adduct name/definition and the # (experimentally determined) m/z and retention time of the ion. To list # compound IDs from the CompDb database: head(compounds(cdb, c("compound_id", "name"))) #>   compound_id         name #> 1           1      Mellein #> 2           2      Mellein #> 3           3      Mellein #> 4           4      Mellein #> 5           5      Mellein #> 6           6 AAL toxin TB  ions = data.frame(compound_id = c("1", "1", "2", "3", "6", "35"),                   ion_adduct = c("[M+H]+", "[M+Na]+", "[M+Na]+",                                  "[M+Na]+", "[M+2H]2+", "[M+H-NH3]+"),                   ion_mz = c(179.0703, 201.0522, 201.0522,                              201.0522, 253.66982, 312.0390),                   ion_rt = 1:6)  # Inserting ion definitions. idb <- insertIon(idb, ions) idb #> class: IonDb  #>  data source: MassBank  #>  version: 2020.09  #>  organism: NA  #>  compound count: 70  #>  MS/MS spectra count: 70  #>  ion count: 6   ions(idb, columns = c("name", "formula", "ion_adduct", "ion_mz", "ion_rt")) #>   ion_adduct   ion_mz ion_rt         name   formula #> 1     [M+H]+ 179.0703      1      Mellein  C10H10O3 #> 2    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      2      Mellein  C10H10O3 #> 3    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      3      Mellein  C10H10O3 #> 4    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      4      Mellein  C10H10O3 #> 5   [M+2H]2+ 253.6698      5 AAL toxin TB C25H47NO9 #> 6 [M+H-NH3]+ 312.0390      6 Aflatoxin G1  C17H12O7  ## List all available ion variables ionVariables(idb) #> [1] "compound_id" "ion_adduct"  "ion_mz"      "ion_rt"       ## Extract a data.frame with ion variables for all ions ions(idb) #>   compound_id ion_adduct   ion_mz ion_rt #> 1           1     [M+H]+ 179.0703      1 #> 2           1    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      2 #> 3           2    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      3 #> 4           3    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      4 #> 5          35 [M+H-NH3]+ 312.0390      6 #> 6           6   [M+2H]2+ 253.6698      5  ## List all database tables and their columns tables(idb) #> $ms_compound #> [1] "compound_id" "formula"     "exactmass"   "smiles"      "inchi"       #> [6] "inchikey"    "cas"         "pubchem"     "name"        #>  #> $ms_ion #> [1] "ion_id"      "compound_id" "ion_adduct"  "ion_mz"      "ion_rt"      #>  #> $msms_spectrum #>  [1] "accession"             "spectrum_name"         "date"                  #>  [4] "authors"               "license"               "copyright"             #>  [7] "publication"           "ms_level"              "polarity"              #> [10] "splash"                "compound_id"           "precursor_intensity"   #> [13] "precursor_mz"          "adduct"                "ionization"            #> [16] "ionization_voltage"    "fragmentation_mode"    "collision_energy_text" #> [19] "instrument"            "instrument_type"       "precursor_mz_text"     #> [22] "spectrum_id"           "collision_energy"      "predicted"             #> [25] "msms_mz_range_min"     "msms_mz_range_max"     #>  #> $msms_spectrum_peak #> [1] "spectrum_id" "mz"          "intensity"   "peak_id"     #>  #> $synonym #> [1] "compound_id" "synonym"     #>   ## Filtering the database ## ## Get all ions with an m/z between 200 and 300 res <- ions(idb, filter = ~ ion_mz > 200 & ion_mz < 300) res #>   compound_id ion_adduct   ion_mz ion_rt #> 1           1    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      2 #> 2           2    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      3 #> 3           3    [M+Na]+ 201.0522      4 #> 4           6   [M+2H]2+ 253.6698      5  ## Get all ions that have a H in their adduct definition. res <- ions(idb, filter = IonAdductFilter("H", "contains")) res #>   compound_id ion_adduct   ion_mz ion_rt #> 1           1     [M+H]+ 179.0703      1 #> 2          35 [M+H-NH3]+ 312.0390      6 #> 3           6   [M+2H]2+ 253.6698      5

title: CompDb-based MS spectrum backend — MsBackendCompDb
code: ## MsBackendCompDb are not expected to be created/instanciated by users ## directly. Users also almost never directly interact with this type of ## object, as it is intented as a pure data backend for the `Spectra` object. ## Users will thus access MS data through such `Spectra` object, which can ## be created for `CompDb` objects using the `Spectra` method (see help ## of the `CompDb` object for more information. This examples shows how ## a `MsBackendCompDb` could be created purely from an SQLite database ## with data from a CompoundDb database.  ## Connect to the SQLite database of a `CompDb` distributed via this package library(RSQLite) library(Spectra) cdb <- CompDb(system.file("sql/CompDb.MassBank.sql", package = "CompoundDb"))  be <- backendInitialize(MsBackendCompDb(), cdb) be #> MsBackendCompDb with 70 spectra #>       msLevel precursorMz  polarity #>     <integer>   <numeric> <integer> #> 1           2      179.07         1 #> 2           2      179.07         1 #> 3           2      179.07         1 #> 4           2      179.07         1 #> 5           2      179.07         1 #> ...       ...         ...       ... #> 66          2     337.091         1 #> 67          2     337.091         1 #> 68          2     337.091         1 #> 69          2     337.091         1 #> 70          2     337.091         1 #>  ... 46 more variables/columns. #>  Use  'spectraVariables' to list all of them. #>  data source: MassBank  #>  version: 2020.09  #>  organism: NA   ## Accessing m/z values mz(be) #> NumericList of length 70 #> [[1]] 133.0648 151.0754 155.9743 161.0597 179.0703 #> [[2]] 133.0648 151.0754 155.9745 161.0597 179.0703 #> [[3]] 105.0699 133.0648 151.0754 161.0597 179.0703 #> [[4]] 105.0699 133.0648 151.0754 161.0597 179.0703 #> [[5]] 105.0699 115.0542 133.0648 151.0754 161.0597 179.0703 #> [[6]] 506.3324 #> [[7]] 276.2686 294.2792 312.287 330.2976 470.3112 488.3218 506.3324 #> [[8]] 56.0502 57.0706 60.045 69.0699 ... 312.287 330.2976 488.3218 506.3324 #> [[9]] 56.0502 57.0706 60.045 67.0542 ... 242.2115 276.2686 294.2792 312.287 #> [[10]] 56.0502 57.0706 60.045 67.0542 ... 159.0288 224.2009 276.2686 294.2792 #> ... #> <60 more elements>

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
text: CompDb databases can created createCompDb emptyCompDb functions, former creating initializing (filling) database existing data, latter creating empty database can subsequently filled insertCompound() insertSpectra() calls. emptyCompDb requires file name database created input returns CompDb representing empty database. createCompDb creates SQLite-based CompDb object/database compound resource provided data.frame tbl. Alternatively, name(s) file(s) annotation extracted can provided. Supported SDF files (Human Metabolome Database HMDB) can read using compound_tbl_sdf() LipidBlast files (see compound_tbl_lipidblast(). additional data.frame providing metadata information including data source, date, version organism mandatory. default, function define name database based provided metadata, also possible define manually dbFile parameter. Optionally MS/MS (MS2) spectra compounds can also stored database. Currently MS/MS spectra HMDB supported. can downloaded XML format HMDB (http://www.hmdb.ca), loaded msms_spectra_hmdb() msms_spectra_mona() function passed function msms_spectra argument. See msms_spectra_hmdb() msms_spectra_mona() information expected columns format. Required columns data.frame providing compound information ( parameter x) : "compound_id": ID compound. Can integer character. Duplicated IDs supported (compatibility reasons), suggested. missing values allowed. "name": compound's name. "inchi": InChI compound. "inchikey": InChI key. "formula": chemical formula. "exactmass": compound's (exact) mass. "synonyms": additional synonyms/aliases compound. either single character list values compound. additional columns provided data.frame (e.g. "smiles" providing compound's SMILES) also supported inserted database table. See e.g. compound_tbl_sdf() compound_tbl_lipidblast() functions creating compound tables. table containing MS2 spectra data following format columns: "spectrum_id": arbitrary ID spectrum. integer. "compound_id": ID compound spectrum can associated . present data.frame defining compounds. "polarity": polarity (integer, 0 negative, 1 positive, NA set). "collision_energy": collision energy. "predicted": whether spectrum predicted measured. "splash": SPLASH spectrum. "instrument_type": instrument type. "instrument": name instrument. "precursor_mz": precursor m/z (numeric). "mz": m/z values. "intensity": intensity values. columns "spectrum_id", "compound_id", "mz" "intensity" value provided row data.frame. others optional. Note data.frame can either format example (.e. row one spectrum columns "mz" "intensity" type list element m/z intensity values one spectrum) full form, row represents one peak columns except "mz" "intensity" containing redundant information spectrum (hence columns "mz" "intensity" type numeric). metadata data.frame supposed two columns named "name" "value" providing following minimal information key-value pairs (see make_metadata utility function create data.frame): "source": source data retrieved (e.g. "HMDB"). "url": url original data retrieved. "source_version": version original data source (e.g. "v4"). "source_date": date original data source generated. "organism": organism. form "Hsapiens" "Mmusculus". createCompDbPackage creates R data package data CompDb object. make_metadata helps generating metadata data.frame correct format expected createCompDb function. function returns data.frame.

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
code: createCompDb(x, metadata, msms_spectra, path = ".", dbFile = character())  createCompDbPackage(   x,   version,   maintainer,   author,   path = ".",   license = "Artistic-2.0" )  make_metadata(   source = character(),   url = character(),   source_version = character(),   source_date = character(),   organism = NA_character_ )  emptyCompDb(dbFile = character())

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
text: x createCompDb: data.frame tbl compound annotations character file name(s) compound annotations retrieved. See description details.   metadata createCompDb: data.frame metadata information. See description details. msms_spectra createCompDb: data.frame MS/MS spectrum data. See msms_spectra_hmdb() expected format function import data spectrum xml files HMDB. path character(1) path directory database file package folder written. Defaults current directory. dbFile character(1) optionally provide name SQLite database file. provided (default) database name defined using information provided metadata. version createCompDbPackage: character(1) version package (ideally format "x.y.z"). maintainer createCompDbPackage: character(1) name email address package maintainer (form "First Last <first.last@provider.com>". author createCompDbPackage: character(1) name package author. license createCompDbPackage: character(1) license package respectively originating provider. source make_metadata: character(1) name resource provided compound annotation. url make_metadata: character(1) url original resource. source_version make_metadata: character(1) version original resource providing annotation. source_date make_metadata: character(1) date resource's release. organism make_metadata: character(1) name organism. format "Hsapiens" human, "Mmusculus" mouse etc. Leave NA applicable.
code: For `createCompDbPackage`: `character(1)` with the file name of the `CompDb` SQLite file (created by `createCompDb`).

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
text: createCompDb: character(1) database name (invisibly).

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
text: Metadata information also used create file name database file. name starts "CompDb", followed organism, data source version. compound database file HMDB version 4 human metabolites thus named: "CompDb.Hsapiens.HMDB.v4". single CompDb database created multiple SDF files (e.g. PubChem) file names provided parameter x. Parallel processing currently enabled SQLite support yet natively.

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
text: Johannes Rainer

title: Create a CompDb database — createCompDb
code: ## Read compounds for a HMDB subset fl <- system.file("sdf/HMDB_sub.sdf.gz", package = "CompoundDb") cmps <- compound_tbl_sdf(fl)  ## Create a metadata data.frame for the compounds. metad <- data.frame(name = c("source", "url", "source_version",     "source_date", "organism"), value = c("HMDB", "http://www.hmdb.ca",     "v4", "2017-08-27", "Hsapiens"))  ## Alternatively use the make_metadata helper function metad <- make_metadata(source = "HMDB", source_version = "v4",     source_date = "2017-08", organism = "Hsapiens",     url = "http://www.hmdb.ca") ## Create a SQLite database in the temporary folder db_f <- createCompDb(cmps, metadata = metad, path = tempdir())  ## The database can be loaded and accessed with a CompDb object db <- CompDb(db_f) db #> class: CompDb  #>  data source: HMDB  #>  version: v4  #>  organism: Hsapiens  #>  compound count: 9   ## Create a database for HMDB that includes also MS/MS spectrum data metad2 <- make_metadata(source = "HMDB_with_spectra", source_version = "v4",     source_date = "2017-08", organism = "Hsapiens",     url = "http://www.hmdb.ca")  ## Import spectrum information from selected MS/MS xml files from HMDB ## that are provided in the package xml_path <- system.file("xml", package = "CompoundDb") spctra <- msms_spectra_hmdb(xml_path) #> Going to process 4 xml files. #> Postprocessing data ...  #> OK  ## Create a SQLite database in the temporary folder db_f2 <- createCompDb(cmps, metadata = metad2, msms_spectra = spctra,     path = tempdir())  ## The database can be loaded and accessed with a CompDb object db2 <- CompDb(db_f2) db2 #> class: CompDb  #>  data source: HMDB_with_spectra  #>  version: v4  #>  organism: Hsapiens  #>  compound count: 9  #>  MS/MS spectra count: 4   ## Does the database contain MS/MS spectrum data? hasMsMsSpectra(db2) #> [1] TRUE  ## Create a database for a ChEBI subset providing the file name of the ## corresponding SDF file metad <- make_metadata(source = "ChEBI_sub", source_version = "2",     source_date = NA, organism = "Hsapiens", url = "www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi") db_f <- createCompDb(system.file("sdf/ChEBI_sub.sdf.gz",     package = "CompoundDb"), metadata = metad, path = tempdir()) #> Import data from ChEBI_sub.sdf.gz ... #> OK db <- CompDb(db_f) db #> class: CompDb  #>  data source: ChEBI_sub  #>  version: 2  #>  organism: Hsapiens  #>  compound count: 6   compounds(db) #>                       name #> 1          (-)-epicatechin #> 2         (1S,4R)-fenchone #> 3   1-alkyl-2-acylglycerol #> 4   16alpha-hydroxyestrone #> 5 what: Expand m/z and intensity values in a data.frame — expandMzIntensity
title: Expand m/z and intensity values in a data.frame — expandMzIntensity
text: expandMzIntensity expands data.frame m/z /intensity values stored list columns "mz" "intensity". resulting data.frame m/z intensity values stored numeric columns "mz" "intensity", one value per row, content columns repeated many times m/z intensity values.

what: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
text: import_mona_sdf allows import compound spectrum information SDF file MoNa (Massbank North America http://mona.fiehnlab.ucdavis.edu/). function convenience function using compound_tbl_sdf() msms_spectra_mona() functions data import avoiding read SDF files twice.

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
code: import_mona_sdf(x, nonStop = TRUE)

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
text: x character(1) SDF file name. nonStop logical(1) wheter file content specific errors reported warnings break full import process.

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
text: list elements "compound" "msms_spectrum" containing data.frames compound MS/MS spectrum data, respectively.

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
text: MoNa SDF files organize data individual spectra (.e. element one spectrum) individual compounds can easily consistently defined (.e. entries InChI ID means uniquely identify compounds). Thus, function returns highly redundant compound table. Feedback reduce redundancy highly welcome!

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
text: Johannes Rainer

title: Import compound and spectrum information from MoNa — import_mona_sdf
code: ## Define the test file containing a small subset from MoNa fl <- system.file("sdf/MoNa_export-All_Spectra_sub.sdf.gz",     package = "CompoundDb")  ## Import the data res <- import_mona_sdf(fl) #> Reading SDF file ...  #> OK #> Extracting compound information ...  #> Warning: MoNa data can currently not be normalized and the compound table contains thus highly redundant data. #> OK #> Extracting spectrum information ...  #> OK

what: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: msms_spectra_hmdb imports MS/MS spectra corresponding xml files HMDB (http://www.hmdb.ca) returns data data.frame. HMDB stores MS/MS spectrum data xml files, one file per spectrum. Depending parameter collapsed, returned data.frame either collapsed, meaning row represents data one spectrum xml file, expanded one row m/z intensity pair spectrum. Columns "mz" "intensity" type list collapsed = TRUE numeric collapsed = FALSE.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
code: msms_spectra_hmdb(x, collapsed = TRUE)

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: x character(1): path directory containing xml files. collapsed logical(1) whether returned data.frame collapsed expanded. See description details.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: data.frame many rows peaks columns: spectrum_id (integer): arbitrary, unique ID identifying values one xml file. original_spectrum_id (character): HMDB-internal ID spectrum. compound_id (character): HMDB compound ID spectrum associated . polarity (integer): 0 negative, 1 positive, NA set. collision_energy (numeric): collision energy voltage. predicted (logical): whether spectrum predicted experimentally verified. splash (character): SPLASH (SPectraL hASH) key spectrum (Wohlgemuth 2016). instrument_type (character): type MS instrument spectrum measured. instrument (character): MS instrument (available spectra HMDB). precursor_mz (numeric): provided HMDB thus NA. mz (numeric list numeric): m/z values spectrum. intensity (numeric list numeric): intensity spectrum.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: HMDB xml files supposed extracted downloaded zip file folder renamed. function identifies xml files containing MS/MS spectra file name. spectrum ID can associated multiple compounds. Thus, function assignes arbitrary ID (column "spectrum_id") values file. original ID spectrum HMDB provided column "original_spectrum_id".

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: Wohlgemuth G, Mehta SS, Mejia RF, Neumann S, Pedrosa D, Pluskal T, Schymanski EL, Willighagen EL, Wilson M, Wishart DS, Arita M, Dorrestein PC, Bandeira N, Wang M, Schulze T, Selak RM, Steinbeck C, Nainala VC, Mistrik R, Nishioka T, Fiehn O. SPLASH, hashed identifier mass spectra. Nature Biotechnology 2016 34(11):1099-1101

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb
text: Johannes Rainer

title: Import MS/MS spectra from HMDB xml files — msms_spectra_hmdb

what: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
title: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
text: msms_spectra_mona imports MS/MS spectra MoNa (Massbank North America, http://mona.fiehnlab.ucdavis.edu/downloads) SDF file returns data data.frame. Depending parameter collapsed, returned data.frame either collapsed, meaning row represents data one spectrum, expanded one row m/z intensity pair spectrum. Columns "mz" "intensity" type list collapsed = TRUE numeric collapsed = FALSE.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
code: msms_spectra_mona(x, collapsed = TRUE)

title: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
text: x character(1): path directory containing xml files. collapsed logical(1) whether returned data.frame collapsed expanded. See description details.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
text: data.frame many rows peaks columns: spectrum_id (integer): arbitrary, unique ID spectrum. original_spectrum_id (character): ID spectrum specified MoNa SDF. compound_id (character): compound ID spectrum associated . polarity (integer): 0 negative, 1 positive, NA set. collision_energy (character): collision energy voltage. predicted (logical): whether spectrum predicted experimentally verified. splash (character): NA since SPLASH (SPectraL hASH) keys provided. instrument_type (character): type MS instrument spectrum measured. instrument (character): MS instrument. precursor_mz (numeric): precursor m/z. adduct (character): ion formed precursor ion. ms_level (integer): stage sequential mass spectrometry (MSn). mz (numeric list numeric): m/z values spectrum. intensity (numeric list numeric): intensity spectrum.

title: Import MS/MS spectra from MoNa — msms_spectra_mona
text: identifiers provided MoNa used original_spectrum_id. Note also MoNa data normalized sense spectrum associated one compound compound data partially redundant. Also, MoNa provide splash spectrum, hence corresponding column contain NA.
